components.description:
A pole spiraled with red, white, and blue stripes, as spins out front of a barbershop. Commonly used for various content concerning haircutting and hairstyling.

May also be associated with brothels in parts of Asia.
components.title: Barber Pole

description:
A pole spiraled with red, white, and blue stripes, as spins out front of a barbershop. Commonly used for various content concerning haircutting and hairstyling.

May also be associated with brothels in parts of Asia.
title: Barber Pole

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Personal care symbols
emoji_net_data.definition: A pole with red, white and blue stripes. Traditionally used by barbers out the front of their place of work. May beÂ used in parts of Asia to http://emojipedia.org/barber-pole/
emoji_net_data.name: barber pole

bn:00025765n: A pass behind or through an object.
Decoration used to embellish parts of a building or object
A gallery of design elements that can be used to embellish publications.
Purely decorative elements in architecture and the decorative arts
In architecture and decorative art, ornament is a decoration used to embellish parts of a building or object.
Rope: pass behind or through an object.
Musical flourishes that are not necessary to the overall melodic (or harmonic) line
An element of decoration; that which embellishes or adorns.
In music, ornaments or embellishments are musical flourishes that are not necessary to carry the overall line of the melody, but serve instead to decorate or "ornament" that line.

bn:00063293n: A long (usually round) rod of wood or metal or plastic
A strong upright piece of wood, metal etc. that is fixed into the ground, especially to support something.
Originally, a stick; now specifically, a long and slender piece of metal or (especially) wood, used for various construction or support purposes.

bn:00009443n: A salon where hairdressers and beauticians work.
A shop where hairdressers and beauticians work
A shop where hairdressers and beauticians work.
A shop that provides hairdressing and beauticians' work.

bn:00008536n: A barber's pole is a type of sign used by barbers to signify the place or shop where they perform their craft.
A type of sign used by barbers, most traditionally a pole with a helix of red and white stripes, in the US including blue, sometimes moving.
A type of sign used by barbers
